author: James Foxx
title: Native tokens for physical assets
description: Physical assets (like artwork, real estate, businesses etc) lack a standard for representation on the blockchain as tokens

assessments.note: This proposal focuses on the business standard, which is one of the components needed in order to really realize the idea and bring it into the hands of soccer fans, which would be what drives adoption.
Interesting idea but does not meet the challenge of "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?"

The idea is very interesting, it is the first proposal that I evaluate that seeks to generate a token from something physical, as was mentioned in the text, the first project would be aimed at a football club. In this way, the use of tokens can be innovative and bring new uses to the cardan community. As it is a new activity, I believe that the process of implementing this practice is a long way, but it is beneficial for the author to have an example to start with. In fact, according to what has been said, this project already has investors from outside the Cardano system, but the author finds it more beneficial if the idea is made within our community. Because we already have an investment, we have more security in relation to the value of the project. The only thing that was still a bit confusing to me is how this project fits the challenge of the apps, I didn't understand where these tokens would be generated, what would be the chosen platform and so on.

Standardization of Native Token to represent a physical assert will provide a template and enable easier app creation in the future. There is a NFT DAO which also looking for standardization, however, a independent initiative to create a standard for a use case can play as a framework for others.

This proposal is lacking technical aspects due to much of it's intention being to flush those details as part of the scope of the proposal itself. I see this as a proposal to explore the idea. Also, the scope is not a deliverable for production, so it is very difficult to asses if this specific component would be useful in the ultimate delivery.
The proposer does not have the technical skills to do this. Without a detailed plan it is hard to say that the funds requested will be enough for the 4 technical staff he wishes to hire.

The author claims to work with artificial intelligence (with 8 years of experience) and computer science, which are two areas directly linked to the project. In addition, he also made his LinkedIn profile available, where we can learn more about his professional career and some examples of companies and projects in which he participated. It is also clear how there is an intention to form a team, because a project as comprehensive as this needs more people involved, different types of professionals and so on. In this way, I believe that the author and his future team will be able to work on the project in a positive way.
The proposer has about 10 years experience in project management, and the proposal is simple and focused. Therefore it is safe to say that the proposal will be successfully implemented.
The proposal has not identified measurable metrics, even though the challenge has a number of specific metrics to go by.

Detailed technical plan required to ascertain whether the funds will be enough to fulfill the idea. Hard to agree a POC of physical tokenisation on a low level UK football club will meet the challenge.

We have here, organized in a numerical list, the future actions that will compose the practical development of the project. In this way, we can have a very clear, objective and chronological view of what is to come. There is also a total estimate of time (2 months), which I believe encompasses all the actions listed numerically. However, it would also be interesting to determine a sense of how long each would take. The author says that the 10k requests for funding is an estimate. It would be safer if we knew how that money would be shared between the parties, from the shares and the participating professionals. Another positive point is that some success metrics are established; the author also claims that there will be feedback to the community, in the form of different media (from what I understand), something that I found very interesting, I did not see many proposals concerned with this part of the project. In this way, I believe that the applicability of the project is well structured, with only a few points missing to make it ideal.

The details are in the open domain, and the project is proposed to be taking the inputs from the community to finalize the standard for a specific use case. The project is auditable, and the success is fairly simple to measure.

solution: Create a community standard that tokenization of physical assets must conform to, to help improve quality, security and ultimately adoption
experience: 8 years as an IT project manager. BSc in Computer Science. https://www.linkedin.com/in/jamesfoxxnl/. Seeking developers to collaborate with.
